article.headline: Lamar 78, Texas A&M-Corpus Christi 77
article.story: BEAUMONT, Texas (AP) -- Darren Hopkins hit a driving layup with six seconds left and added a free throw for a three-point play to give Lamar a 78-77 victory over Texas A&M-Corpus Christi Thursday night. Texas A&M-Corpus Christi got the ball but Lamar deflected the Islanders' inbounds pass after a timeout with 2.6 seconds left. Hopkins led Lamar (12-14, 6-6 Southland) with 26 points, including 4-of-7 3-pointers. James Davis came off the bench to add 18 points and Currye Todd and Brandon Chappell each had 11 for the Cardinals. Texas A&M-Corpus Christi (20-6, 11-2) led by 12 points at 67-55 with Cedric Smith's dunk with 7:36 left. Lamar outscored the Islanders 20-6 over the next 5:57 to take a 76-73 lead. Chappell had two 3-pointers and Hopkins had one during the run. Chris Daniels led the Islanders with 23 points. Scooby Johnson added 15 and Smith had 14. The Islanders led 36-32 at the half. Texas A&M-Corpus Christi shot 51 percent from the field while Lamar shot 47 percent.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
